original: Paṭṭhānapakaraṇa🔽Dhammapaccanīyānuloma (4), Dukatikapaṭṭhānapāḷi (3)🔽21.2. Sahetukadukādi, Kusalattika🔽Nasahetukaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sahetuko kusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ.🔽Nasahetukaṁ naakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā sahetuko akusalo dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.) Hetuyā ekaṁ, ārammaṇe tīṇi, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.🔽Nasahetukaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ahetuko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.
analyzed: paṭṭhāna pakaraṇa  dhamma paccanīya anuloma duka tika paṭṭhāna pāḷi  sa hetuka duka ādi kusala ttika  na sa hetukam na kusalam dhammam paccayā sa hetukaḥ kusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka  na sa hetukam na akusalam dhammam paccayā sa hetukaḥ akusalaḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā saṅkhitta hetuyā eka ārammaṇe tīṇi adhipatiyā ekam pe avigate tīṇi  na sahetukam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca ahetukaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā

original: Naahetukaṁ naabyākataṁ dhammaṁ paṭicca ahetuko abyākato dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā.🔽Nasahetukaṁ naabyākatañca naahetukaṁ naabyākatañca dhammaṁ paṭicca ahetuko abyākato🔽dhammo uppajjati hetupaccayā. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na ahetukam na abyākatam dhammam paṭicca ahetukaḥ abyākataḥ dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā 🔽na sahetukam na abyākatam ca na ahetukam na abyākatam ca dhammam paṭicca ahetukaḥ abyākataḥ 🔽dhammaḥ uppajjati hetu paccayā

original: Hetuyā tīṇi, adhipatiyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate tīṇi.
analyzed: hetuyā tīṇi adhipatiyā ekam pe avigate tīṇi
translated: There are three lines of reasoning for the cause condition, one line for the predominance condition, … and three lines for the non-obstruction condition.

original: Nahetusampayuttaṁ nakusalaṁ dhammaṁ paccayā …pe… hetuyā ekaṁ …pe… avigate ekaṁ. (Saṅkhittaṁ.)
analyzed: na hetu sampayuttam na kusalam dhammam paccayā pe hetuyā ekam pe avigate eka
translated: With respect to the unwholesome dhamma which is neither a cause nor related to a cause, there is one line of reasoning for the cause condition, … and one line for the non-obstruction condition. (Abbreviated.)

original: Nahetu ceva naahetuko ca nakusalo dhammo hetussa ceva sahetukassa ca kusalassa dhammassa🔽ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Nahetu ceva naahetuko ca nakusalo dhammo sahetukassa ceva🔽na ca hetussa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Nahetu ceva naahetuko
analyzed: na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ ca na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa ca iva sa hetukassa ca kusalassa dhammassa  ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ ca na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ sa hetukassa ca iva  na ca hetussa kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ
translated: The unwholesome dhamma which is neither a cause nor related to a cause is related to the wholesome dhamma which is a cause and related to a cause,🔽as object condition. The unwholesome dhamma which is neither a cause nor related to a cause is related to the wholesome dhamma which is related to a cause but not a cause,

original: ca nakusalo dhammo hetussa ceva sahetukassa kusalassa ca sahetukassa ceva na ca hetussa
analyzed: ca na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa ca iva sa hetukassa kusalassa ca sa hetukassa ca iva na ca hetussa
translated: as object condition. The unwholesome dhamma which is neither a cause nor related to a cause is related to the wholesome dhamma which is a cause and related to a cause, and to the wholesome dhamma which is related to a cause but not a cause,

original: kusalassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: kusalassa ca dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: as object condition. … There are three lines.

original: Naahetuko ceva nana ca hetu nakusalo dhammo hetussa ceva sahetukassa ca kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: na ahetukaḥ ca iva na na ca hetu na kusalaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa ca iva sa hetukassa ca kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: The wholesome dhamma which is neither a cause nor related to a cause is related to the wholesome dhamma which is a cause and related to a cause, as object condition. … There are three lines.

original: Nahetu ceva naahetuko nakusalo ca naahetuko ceva nanahetu nakusalo ca dhammā hetussa ceva sahetukassa ca kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi.
analyzed: na hetu ceva na ahetukaḥ na kusalaḥ ca na ahetukaḥ ca iva na na hetu na kusalaḥ ca dhammā hetussa ca iva sa hetukassa ca kusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi
translated: Neither-cause-nor-effect and not-related-to-causation and not-skillful dhammas are conditions, as object condition, for cause and related-to-causation and skillful dhammas. … There are three.
In object, predominance, and support, there are nine.

original: Nahetu ceva naahetuko ca naakusalo dhammo hetussa ceva sahetukassa ca akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo. Ārammaṇe adhipatiyā upanissaye nava.🔽Nahetu ceva naahetuko ca naabyākato dhammo hetussa ceva sahetukassa ca abyākatassa
analyzed: na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ ca na akusalaḥ dhammaḥ hetussa ca iva sa hetukassa ca akusalassa dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ ārammaṇe adhipatiyā upanissaye nava  na hetu ca iva na ahetukaḥ ca na abyākataḥ dhammaḥ hetussa ca iva sa hetukassa ca abyākatassa
translated: Neither-cause-nor-effect and not-related-to-causation and not-unskillful dhammas are conditions, as object condition, for cause and related-to-causation and unskillful dhammas. In object, predominance, and support, there are nine.

original: dhammassa ārammaṇapaccayena paccayo … tīṇi. Ārammaṇe adhipatiyā anantare samanantare
analyzed: dhammassa ārammaṇa paccayena paccayaḥ tīṇi ārammaṇe adhipatiyā anantare samanantare
translated: Neither-cause-nor-effect and not-related-to-causation and neutral dhammas are conditions, as object condition, for cause and related-to-causation and neutral dhammas. … There are three. In object, predominance, proximity, immediacy,

original: upanissaye nava, kamme tīṇi, natthiyā vigate nava.
analyzed: upanissaye nava kamme tīṇi natthiyāḥ vigate nava
translated: and support, there are nine. In kamma, there are three. In absence and disappearance, there are nine.
